Text:
I have built an app (with Apache Cordova). I want to sign it. I follow this instructions.
http://developer.android.com/tools/publishing/app-signing.html#signing-manually

After

    $ jarsigner -verbose -sigalg SHA1withRSA -digestalg SHA1 -keystore my-release-key.keystore my_application.apk alias_name

I get this:

`jarsigner: Certificate chain not found for: alias_name.  alias_name must reference a valid KeyStore key entry containing a private key and corresponding public key certificate chain.`

I have put the unsigned app file `my_application.apk` in the same folder as `my-release-key.keystore`, of course.

What can I do?

I have built an app (with Apache Cordova). I want to sign it. I follow this instructions.
http://developer.android.com/tools/publishing/app-signing.html#signing-manually

After

    $ jarsigner -verbose -sigalg SHA1withRSA -digestalg SHA1 -keystore my-release-key.keystore my_application.apk alias_name

I get this:

`jarsigner: Certificate chain not found for: alias_name.  alias_name must reference a valid KeyStore key entry containing a private key and corresponding public key certificate chain.`


I have create the unsigned app file like this:

    ..../my_application$ cordova build android --release


I have put the file `my_application.apk` in the same folder as `my-release-key.keystore`, of course.

What can I do?

I have built an app (with Apache Cordova). I want to sign it. I follow this instructions.
http://developer.android.com/tools/publishing/app-signing.html#signing-manually

After

    $ jarsigner -verbose -sigalg SHA1withRSA -digestalg SHA1 -keystore my-release-key.keystore my_application.apk `alias_name`

I get this:

`jarsigner error: java.security.SignatureException: private key algorithm is not compatible with signature algorithm`


I have create the unsigned app file like this:

    ..../my_application$ cordova build android --release


I have put the file `my_application.apk` in the same folder as `my-release-key.keystore`, of course.

What can I do?
